author: stefanbratanov
content: Will <@520034910149410861> simpler fork choice design be specced at some point? For Teku, the fork choice changes still need more work since are quite involving and didn't have time to work on it during DevCon, so what is the consensus about the specs for a multi-client interop ?

author: potuz
content: Working on this during this week, will open the spec PR in a couple of days

author: potuz
content: As for interop, no need to worry much about forkchoice, the idea is to simply check if we can actually send and import blocks. If we're "only" split on forkchoice that'd be great!

author: potuz
content:
<@654267572107083777> had written a list of requirements for interop somewhere but I can't see them anywhere. Anyway they looked like this
- full state transition
- self building, no bid propagation on P2P
- PTC attestations broadcasting and packing on blocks, but not necessarily counted at all in forkchoice (they need to be counted for rewards) 
- no forkchoice changes other than dealing with the possible empty blocks

author: potuz
content: Unfortunately Francesco's change will also change the PTC object so that's the only thing we will be trying to interop with something we know will change.
